reporting_cycle: Secretary-General reports not explicitly mentioned, but Panel of Experts to provide reports: midterm report by 3 August 2020 and 4 September 2020, final report by 5 February 2021 and 5 March 2021
summary:
The Security Council, recalling its previous relevant resolutions and statements, 
1. Extends until 30 April 2021 the mandate of the Panel of Experts, as specified in paragraph 26 of resolution 1874 (2009) and modified in paragraph 29 of resolution 2094 (2013), and applies this mandate to measures imposed in resolutions 2270 (2016), 2321 (2016), 2356 (2017), 2371 (2017), 2375 (2017), and 2397 (2017).
2. Requests the Panel to provide a midterm report to the Committee by 3 August 2020, and to the Council by 4 September 2020, and a final report to the Committee by 5 February 2021, and to the Council by 5 March 2021.
3. Requests the Panel to provide a planned programme of work to the Committee within thirty days of reappointment and to provide updates to this programme.
4. Expresses its intent to continue to follow the work of the Panel.
5. Urges all States, UN bodies, and interested parties to cooperate fully with the Committee and the Panel of Experts.
6. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
